comments:
Clicking in the column header of the task does not appear to do anything.  The
compilier errors are still below the tasks and above some tasks as well.   Order
seems random.

With the RC1 build (20030221) I created a workspace with all the plugins 
required by org.eclipse.ui (File->Import->External Plug-ins and Fragemnets)
Checked extract source, then selected org.eclipse.ui, select Add Required Plug-
ins.

I then removed IPreferenceConstants#CLOSE_EDITORS_ON_EXIT
So now I have 94 items: 30 tasks, 5 errors, 59 warnings, 0 infos

Sorting works for all column headers. (type, completed, priority, description,
Resource, Description, Location)

Where there any logs generated when you observed this failed sorting?
<workspace>/.metadata/.log

it acts pretty wierd when you click on the header of the icons column.
I would expect it to be sorted by priority, since the icons seems to represent 
priority.
but it does not work according to anything I have noticed.

By icons I assume you are referring to the first column.  When I click on that 
column I get the errors first, then warnings, then all the TODOs.  If I have a 
task selected prior to clicking on the column header I am positioned on that 
task when I am done.

Can you attach a screen shot of the behaviour you are seeing?  Maximize the 
task list so we can see as much as possible.

It actually appears to be working for me now but for a while there were errors
in between tasks and clicking the top of the column did not change the order.

There are some entries in my log file from Feb 28 so I'll attach those.
